column2: location=On the lower course of the [[Glanduin]] in [[Eriador]]

column1: The '''Swanfleet''' or '''Nîn-in-Eilph''' was a marshy area in eastern [[Eriador]] through which the lower reaches of the [[Glanduin]] (or "Swanfleet river") flowed before it joined the [[Mitheithel]] (Hoarwell).<ref>{{UT
column2: Map}}</ref> The Swanfleet was effectively an inland delta, with uncertain streams and a very uncertain difference between land and water.

column1: It strongly resembled the [[Gladden Fields]] on the other side of [[Misty Mountains
column2: Hithaeglir]], and as such many [[Stoors]] felt right at home here after their migration into [[Eriador]]. These Stoors remained here until the [[Great Plague]] nearly wiped them out, and the remainder then went to the [[Southfarthing]] of [[the Shire]].

column1: At the east end of the Swanfleet was a waterfall, beyond which was a ford over the Glanduin,<ref>{{RK
column2: VI6}}</ref> from where led a road to the ruins of [[Ost-in-Edhil]], the ruined city of [[Eregion]].<ref>{{S

column1: The name ''Nîn-in-Eilph'' is [[Sindarin]] for "water-lands of the Swans".<ref>{{VT
